notes:
The 1997 Rallye Monte Carlo was the first rally where the all-new World Rally Car-spec cars saw competition. Subaru's WRC-spec car was the Impreza GC WRC97 (rolls of the tongue, doesn't it?) with Colin McRae as the primary driver supported by Piero Liatti, Olivier Burri, and Kenneth Eriksson. Subaru had just won it's second consecutive Constructors' Championship the prior year so there were high hopes for this new car.

Liatti & co-driver Fabrizia Pons (co-driver for legends Michèle Mouton & Ari Vatanen) won the most stages (9) and the rally outright. Winning the new WRC-spec Subaru's inagural rally would be the high point of Liatti's career as this was his only WRC event win albeit a very auspicious win. This would also be Pons' last win as a co-driver but she wound up with 4 more than Liatti.
